content:
ChartColorPalette Enum

Definition

Specifies a palette when setting a Palette property.

In this Article

public enum ChartColorPalette
Inheritance
Object
ValueType
Enum
ChartColorPalette

Remarks

The ChartColorPalette enumeration represents the palettes to be used for the root Chart object and any Series objects.

If no colors are assigned to data points and their associated series, the default colors will be assigned to the data. For example:

  • If Palette is set to None, then the default palette is set to PaletteCustomColors or BrightPastel.

    If.Palette is set to None, then the default palette for the chart is used (Palette).

Fields

Berry

Palette utilizes blues and purples.
Bright

Palette utilizes bright colors.
BrightPastel

Palette utilizes bright pastel colors.
Chocolate

Palette utilizes shades of brown.
EarthTones

Palette utilizes earth tone colors such as green and brown.
Excel

Palette utilizes Excel-style colors.
Fire

Palette utilizes red, orange and yellow colors.
Grayscale

Palette utilizes grayscale colors, that is, shades of black and white.
Light

Palette utilizes LightStyle style colors; very light colors..
None

No palette is used.
Pastel

Palette utilizes pastel colors.
SeaGreen

Palette utilizes colors that range from green to blue.
SemiTransparent

Palette utilizes semi-transparent colors.
